Prijeli okrog 150 ilegalnih prebežnikov in več organizatorjev prehodov
04 Nov 2019, 13:50 by Spletno uredništvo

Policisti so na območju Policijske uprave Koper od 30. oktobra do danes do 6. ure obravnavali večje število ilegalnih prehodov. Obravnavali so približno 150 oseb, ki so nedovoljeno prestopile državno mejo med Hrvaško in Slovenijo. Največ so jih obravnavali bistriški policisti.



Foto: STA

KOPER > V četrtek ob 5. uri so policisti na cesti za Mune ustavili osebni avto italijanskih registrskih tablic, ki ga je peljal Albanec. V vozilu sta bila še dva Albanca, ki sta prišla v Slovenijo nezakonito. Potnika so vrnili na Hrvaško, voznika pa s kazensko ovadbo privedli k preiskovalnemu sodniku, ki je zanj odredil pripor.
V petek ob 20.15 so policisti v Dolnjih Ležečah ustavili osebni avto hrvaških registrskih številk, ki ga je vozil 53-letni Hrvat. V vozilu so bili trije Turki, ki so prišli v Slovenijo nelegalno. Hrvata so s kazensko ovadbo privedli k preiskovalnemu sodniku, ki je zanj odredil pripor.
V soboto so policisti ob 22. uri v Knežaku opazili tri vozila italijanskih registrskih tablic (zafira, megane in passat), ki so vozila proti Šembijam. Ustavili so jih pri Knežaku. V passatu sta bila Romun in Italijanka, v zafiri je bilo deset Eritrejcev, en Afganistanec in en Pakistanec, voznik je pobegnil, v meganu pa sta bila Pakistanca z urejenim statusom v Italiji. Kmalu zatem so v Knežaku prijeli tudi pobeglega voznika zafire. Policisti so pridržali pet osumljenih kaznivega dejanja ilegalnega vodenja preko državne meje, in sicer tri Pakistance, Romuna in Italijanko. 12 tujcev, ki so prišli v Slovenijo nelegalno, so odpeljali v Center za tujce. Vsi postopki še potekajo.

Apprehended about 150 illegal fugitives and several crossing organizers
04 Nov 2019, 13:50 by Web Editing

Police officers dealt with a large number of illegal crossings in the area of the Koper Police Directorate from October 30 until today until 6 am. Approximately 150 persons were treated as crossing the state border between Croatia and Slovenia. Most of them were addressed by Bistrica police officers.



Photo: STA

KOPER> On Thursday at 5am police officers stopped a passenger car in an Italian license plate driven by an Albanian. There were two other Albanians in the vehicle who came to Slovenia illegally. The passenger was returned to Croatia, and the driver was brought to the investigating judge with a criminal complaint, who ordered him into custody.
On Friday at 8.15pm, police officers in Dolnje Ležeče stopped a passenger car with Croatian registration numbers, driven by a 53-year-old Croat. There were three Turks in the vehicle who came to Slovenia illegally. The criminal complaint was brought to the investigating judge, who ordered him detained.
On Saturday, at 10pm police officers spotted three Italian license plate vehicles (zafira, megane and passat) heading towards Šembije in Knezak. They were stopped at Knežak. There were Romanian and Italian in the passat, ten Eritreans in the zafir, one Afghan and one Pakistani; Shortly afterwards, an escaped Zafira driver was apprehended in Knezak. Police officers detained five suspected criminal offenses of running illegally across the state border, three Pakistani, Romanian and Italian. 12 foreigners who came to Slovenia illegally were taken to the Center for Foreigners. All procedures are still in progress.
